events.originalText: A gunman opened fire into a crowded lecture hall at Northern Illinois University in DeKalb, killing five people and injuring twenty-one others.
events.subtitle: 2008 Northern Illinois University shooting
events.headline: Gunman kills five at Northern Illinois University in DeKalb

events.originalText: The first of several bombings in Zahedan, Iran, killed 18 members of the Revolutionary Guards.
events.subtitle: 2007 Zahedan bombings
events.headline: First bombing in Zahedan, Iran kills 18 Revolutionary Guards

events.originalText: The video-sharing web site YouTube was founded by three former PayPal employees.
events.subtitle: Online video platform
events.headline: YouTube founded by former PayPal employees

events.originalText: Sri Temasek (pictured), the official residence of the prime minister of Singapore, was declared a national monument.
events.subtitle: Sri Temasek
events.headline: Sri Temasek declared national monument in Singapore

events.originalText: NASA's Voyager 1 space probe took the Pale Blue Dot photograph of Earth (cropped version pictured) from a record distance of 40.5 au (6.06 billion km; 3.76 billion mi).
events.subtitle: NASA
events.headline: Voyager 1 captures Pale Blue Dot photo from record distance

events.originalText: Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini of Iran issued a fatwa calling for the death of Salman Rushdie, the author of The Satanic Verses, a novel considered to be blasphemous by some Muslims.
events.subtitle: Ruhollah Khomeini
events.headline: Fatwa issued against Salman Rushdie by Ayatollah Khomeini

events.originalText: 48 people died when a fire broke out during a Valentine's Day dance at a Dublin nightclub.
events.subtitle: Stardust fire
events.headline: 48 dead in Dublin nightclub fire on Valentine's Day

events.originalText: Adolph Dubs, United States Ambassador to Afghanistan, was kidnapped by unknown agents and killed during a gun battle between Afghan police and the perpetrators.
events.subtitle: Adolph Dubs
events.headline: US Ambassador to Afghanistan kidnapped and killed

events.originalText: Lawrencium, the radioactive synthetic element with atomic number 103, was first synthesized at the Lawrence Radiation Laboratory on the campus of the University of California, Berkeley.
events.subtitle: Lawrencium
events.headline: Lawrencium first synthesized at University of California, Berkeley

events.originalText: World War II: General Hans-Jürgen von Arnim's 5th Panzer Army launched a concerted attack against Allied positions in Tunisia.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: General von Arnim's 5th Panzer Army attacks Allied positions in Tunisia

events.originalText: The Singapore Naval Base, the cornerstone of the Singapore strategy, a British naval defence policy, was opened.
events.subtitle: Singapore Naval Base
events.headline: Singapore Naval Base opens as cornerstone of defense strategy

events.originalText: The Computing-Tabulating-Recording Company was renamed as International Business Machines (IBM), later growing into one of the world's largest companies by market capitalization.
events.subtitle: Computing-Tabulating-Recording Company
events.headline: Computing-Tabulating-Recording Company becomes IBM

events.originalText: The Battle of Bereza Kartuska, the first serious armed conflict of the Polish–Soviet War, took place near present-day Biaroza, Belarus.
events.subtitle: Battle of Bereza Kartuska
events.headline: Battle of Bereza Kartuska marks start of Polish-Soviet War

events.originalText: The animated film Gertie the Dinosaur was released, later greatly influencing future animators such as the Fleischer brothers and Walt Disney.
events.subtitle: Gertie the Dinosaur
events.headline: Gertie the Dinosaur film released, influencing future animators

events.originalText: The Hospital for Sick Children, the first hospital in England to provide in-patient beds specifically for children, was founded in London.
events.subtitle: Great Ormond Street Hospital
events.headline: Hospital for Sick Children founded in London

events.originalText: Serb chieftains elected Đorđe Petrović as their leader and began an uprising against the Ottoman Empire.
events.subtitle: Karađorđe
events.headline: Serb chieftains elect Đorđe Petrović as leader

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: A militia of Patriots decisively defeated and scattered a Loyalist militia that was on its way to British-controlled Augusta, Georgia.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Patriots defeat Loyalist militia in American Revolutionary War

events.originalText: Native Hawaiians killed the English explorer Captain James Cook after he attempted to kidnap Kalaniʻōpuʻu, the ruling chief of the island of Hawaii.
events.subtitle: Death of James Cook
events.headline: Native Hawaiians kill Captain James Cook in Hawaii

events.originalText: Arauco War: A series of coordinated Mapuche attacks took place against Spanish settlements and forts in colonial Chile, beginning a ten-year period of warfare.
events.subtitle: Arauco War
events.headline: Mapuche attacks begin Arauco War in colonial Chile
